edu.rit.image

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.image.Color
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable

    public class Color
extends Object
implements Streamable
    Class Color provides a color. The color can be specified as red-green-blue (RGB) components or as hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) components.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Color()
      Construct a new color object.
      Color(Color color)
      Construct a new color object that is a copy of the given color object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Color

        public Color()
        Construct a new color object. The red, green, and blue components are 0, yielding the color black.

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • rgb

        public int rgb()
        Get the packed RGB representation of this color object. The packed RGB representation is an int with bits 31-24 unused, the red component in bits 23-16, the green component in bits 15-8, and the blue component in bits 7-0.
        Returns:
        Packed RGB representation.

        Returns:
        Red component (0 .. 255).

        public Color rgb(int rgb)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This color object.

      • rgb

        public Color rgb(int red,
        int green,
        int blue)
        Set this color object from the given integer red, green, and blue components. Each component is a value in the range 0 .. 255. (Only bits 7-0 are used.) A component value of 0 is fully dark; a component value of 255 is fully bright.
        Parameters:
        red - Red component (0 .. 255).
        green - Green component (0 .. 255).
        blue - Blue component (0 .. 255).
        Returns:
        This color object.

      • rgb

        public Color rgb(float red,
        float green,
        float blue)
        Set this color object from the given floating point red, green, and blue components. Each component is a value in the range 0.0f .. 1.0f. (Values outside that range are pinned to that range.) A component value of 0.0f is fully dark; a component value of 1.0f is fully bright.
        Parameters:
        red - Red component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        green - Green component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        blue - Blue component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        Returns:
        This color object.

      • hsb

        public Color hsb(float hue,
        float sat,
        float bri)
        Set this color object from the given floating point hue, saturation, and brightness components. Each component is a value in the range 0.0f .. 1.0f. (Values outside that range are pinned to that range.)

        The hue component gives the basic color. A hue of 0 = red; 1/6 = yellow; 2/6 = green; 3/6 = cyan; 4/6 = blue; 5/6 = magenta; 1 = red again. Intermediate hue values yield intermediate colors.

        The saturation component specifies how gray or colored the color is. A saturation of 0 yields fully gray; a saturation of 1 yields fully colored. Intermediate saturation values yield mixtures of gray and colored.

        The brightness component specifies how dark or light the color is. A brightness of 0 yields fully dark (black); a brightness of 1 yields fully light (somewhere between white and colored depending on the saturation). Intermediate brightness values yield somewhere between a gray shade and a darkened color (depending on the saturation).

        Parameters:
        hue - Hue component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        sat - Saturation component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        bri - Brightness component (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        Returns:
        This color object.

      • gray

        public Color gray(int gray)
        Set this color object to the given integer gray value. The gray value is in the range 0 .. 255. (Only bits 7-0 are used.) A value of 0 is black; a value of 255 is white.
        Parameters:
        gray - Gray value (0 .. 255).
        Returns:
        This color object.

      • gray

        public Color gray(float gray)
        Set this color object to the given floating point gray value. The gray value is in the range 0.0f .. 1.0f. (Values outside that range are pinned to that range.) A value of 0.0f is black; a value of 1.0f is white.
        Parameters:
        gray - Gray value (0.0f .. 1.0f).
        Returns:
        This color object.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string version of this color object. The string is in hexadecimal HTML format; for example, "#123456".
